intro: Psychotria pseudaxillaris, commonly known as the pink psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an epiphytic shrub, attaching itself to trees in the canopy of tropical forests. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a glossy surface, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals.
